elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the balance sheet.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: What is a balance sheet?
elements.correctAnswer: A comparison of assets (assets) and liabilities (liabilities) on a reporting date.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: What are the assets of a company?
elements.correctAnswer: The assets form the assets of a company.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Which accounts belong to current assets?
elements.correctAnswer: Cash, post office, bank, trade receivables, inventories

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the balance sheet.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: What do the passives show?
elements.correctAnswer: The liabilities show the debts of a company. All assets of a company are procured with funds that come from various creditors (lenders). The claims of these lenders on the company in question are called liabilities.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: How can the liabilities be subdivided?
elements.correctAnswer: Liabilities are divided into borrowed capital and equity. Liabilities are claims from creditors outside the company. These must be repaid after a certain period of time. Equity corresponds to the residual claim of the company's owners; it is generally available for an indefinite period.
